repnme.cdata!: Ukraine - Roads and Safety Improvement Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Roads and Safety
            Improvement Project for Ukraine were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was substantial, the Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            improving design of civil works: consultations during the
            design phase and continuous engagement with local
            communities during implementation improve compliance with
            safeguard policies, as well as project design. The continued
            engagement resulting from a sequenced approach (a number of
            consecutive projects) to lending and complementary trust
            funds can provide a platform to improve sector dialogue
            where the World Bank is a new player in the sector. An
            effective road safety strategy requires investments in
            infrastructure as well as substantial measures to strengthen
            institutions, including a complementary safety education
            campaign and enforcement. Both approaches developed under
            this project, although contributing to a reduction in
            accidents, focused mainly on infrastructure improvements.
            Issues with counterpart funding caused delays during project
            implementation. In particular, the financial position of
            local firms was compromised. Furthermore, the recent budget
            constraints in Ukraine have adversely affected the ability
            of the government to finance Value Added Tax, or VAT, land
            acquisition, design work, and the operating expenses of
            relevant entities associated with project implementation.
            The World Bank should consider more systematically financing
            100 percent of project costs to minimize the risks to
            implementation caused by a delay of funds coming from the government.

repnme.cdata!:
Ukraine - Roads and Safety Improvement
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Roads
            and Safety Improvement Project for Ukraine is to improve the
            condition and quality of sections along M-03 highway, and
            increase road safety throughout Ukraine. The closing date of
            the will be extended from 31-Dec-2012 until 31-Dec 2013. The
            extension is necessary since some of the civil works
            contracts cannot be completed before the original closing
            date. This is especially valid for the additional contracts
            which were awarded after the first restructuring of the
            project. This will be the first extension of the project
            closing date.

display_title.display_title:
Ukraine - Roads and Safety
            Improvement Project : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet
